text: touchdown in Nebraska one tornado is bad
enough the power of two at once is
unbelievable it's a rare sight to see
and an extremely dangerous one to a mile
wide and just a mile apart they barrel
across the land nothing escapes
destruction that wants to massive wedges
rotating pilger is just northwest of
Omaha the county sheriff says the
tornados wiped more than half the town
off the map just look at the destruction
that's left behind they used to be homes
here now it looks like a junkyard the
buildings that did survive a gutted
trees and power lines have been brought
down in a matter of minutes the lives of
those from this small town of Pilger
have been literally turned upside down
there's barely a square inch untouched
by the tornadoes the locals are trying
to clear up the mess but it will take
months to repair the damage Nebraska was
the worst hit but not the only casualty
South Dakota was saturated by heavy
rains and 80 mile an hour winds tore
through towns in Iowa Rivers burst their
banks sending dirty water surging into
towns the National Weather Service has
already warned that more severe storms
are forming so it's definitely not over
yet Wendy Urquhart BBC News
